definition.name: NXms_score_results

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n_b
symbol.doc: Number of boundaries of the bounding box or primitive to domain.

symbol.name: n_p
symbol.doc: Number of parameter required for chosen orientation parameterization.

symbol.name: n_front
symbol.doc: Number of active cells in the (recrystallization) front.

symbol.name: n_grains
symbol.doc: Number of grains in the computer simulation.

definition.doc:
Application definition for storing results of the SCORE cellular automaton.
The SCORE cellular automaton model for primary recrystallization is an example of typical materials engineering applications used within the field of so-called Integral Computational Materials Engineering (ICME) whereby one can simulate the evolution of microstructures.
Specifically the SCORE model can be used to simulate the growth of static recrystallization nuclei. The model is described in the literature:
* `M. KÃ¼hbach et al. <https://doi.org/10.1016/j.actamat.2016.01.068>`_ * `C. Haase et al. <https://doi.org/10.1016/j.actamat.2015.08.057>`_ * `M. Diehl et al. <https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-651X/ab51bd>`_

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: An at least as strong as SHA256 hashvalue of the file that specifies the application definition.

field.name: definition
field.doc: NeXus NXDL schema to which this file conforms.

field.name: analysis_identifier
field.doc:
Ideally, a (globally) unique persistent identifier for referring to this computer simulation.
The identifier is usually defined/issued by the facility, laboratory, or the principle investigator. The identifier enables to link experiments to e.g. proposals.

field.name: analysis_description
field.doc:
Free-text description about the workflow (analysis/simulation).
Users are strongly advised to detail the sample history in the respective field and fill rather as completely as possible the fields of this application definition rather than write details about the experiment into this free-text description field.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the characterization started.

field.name: end_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 time code with local time zone offset to UTC included when the characterization ended.

field.name: experiment_or_simulation
field.doc: Specify if the (characterization) results/data of this instance of an application definition are based on the results of a simulation or the results of a post-processing of measured data to describe a microstructure. The term microstructure is used to describe the spatial arrangement of crystal defects inside a sample/specimen without demanding necessarily that this structure is mainly at the micron length scale. Nanostructure and macrostructure are close synonyms. Material architecture is a narrow synonym.

field.name: config_filename
field.doc: The path and name of the config file for this analysis.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: At least SHA256 strong hash of the specific config_file for tracking provenance.

field.name: results_path
field.doc: Path to the directory where the tool should store NeXus/HDF5 results of this analysis. If not specified results will be stored in the current working directory.

field.name: status
field.doc:
A statement whether the SCORE executable managed to process the analysis or failed prematurely.
This status is written to the results file after the end_time at which point the executable must not compute any analysis. Only when this status message is present and shows `success`, the user should consider the results. In all other cases it might be that the executable has terminated prematurely or another error occurred.

group.name: USER
group.doc: Contact information and eventually details of at least one person involved in creating this result. This can be the principle investigator who performed this experiment. Adding multiple users if relevant is recommended.

field.name: name
field.doc: Given (first) name and surname of the user.

field.name: affiliation
field.doc: Name of the affiliation of the user at the point in time when the experiment was performed.

field.name: address
field.doc: Postal address of the affiliation.

field.name: email
field.doc: Email address of the user at the point in time when the experiment was performed. Writing the most permanently used email is recommended.

field.name: orcid
field.doc: Globally unique identifier of the user as offered by services like ORCID or ResearcherID. If this field is field the specific service should also be written in orcid_platform

field.name: orcid_platform
field.doc: Name of the OrcID or ResearcherID where the account under orcid is registered.

field.name: telephone_number
field.doc: (Business) (tele)phone number of the user at the point in time when the experiment was performed.

field.name: role
field.doc: Which role does the user have in the place and at the point in time when the experiment was performed? Technician operating the microscope. Student, postdoc, principle investigator, guest are common examples.

field.name: social_media_name
field.doc: Account name that is associated with the user in social media platforms.

field.name: social_media_platform
field.doc: Name of the social media platform where the account under social_media_name is registered.

field.name: name
field.doc: Descriptive name or ideally (globally) unique persistent identifier.

group.doc: Hard link to a location in the hierarchy of the NeXus file where the data for default plotting are stored.

Container to hold different coordinate systems conventions. A least a right-handed Cartesian coordinate system with base vectors named x, y, and z has to be specified. Each base vector of the coordinate system should be described with an NXtransformations instance.

group.name: ROI_SET
group.doc: The simulated or characterized material volume element aka domain. At least one instance of geometry required either NXcg_grid, NXcg_polyhedron_set, or NXcg_point_set. This geometry group needs to contain details about the boundary conditions.

group.name: boundary
group.doc: A tight bounding box or sphere or bounding primitive about the grid.

field.name: number_of_boundaries
field.doc: How many distinct boundaries are distinguished? Most grids discretize a cubic or cuboidal region. In this case six sides can be distinguished, each making an own boundary.

field.name: boundaries
field.doc: Name of the boundaries. E.g. left, right, front, back, bottom, top, The field must have as many entries as there are number_of_boundaries.

field.name: boundary_conditions
field.doc:
The boundary conditions for each boundary:
0 - undefined 1 - open 2 - periodic 3 - mirror 4 - von Neumann 5 - Dirichlet

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer which specifies the first index to be used for distinguishing snapshots. Identifiers are defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing the identifiers are defined on the interval [identifier_offset, identifier_offset+c-1]. For explicit indexing the identifier array has to be defined.
The identifier_offset field can for example be used to communicate if the identifiers are expected to start from 1 (referred to as Fortran-/Matlab-) or from 0 (referred to as C-, Python-style index notation) respectively.

group.name: evolution
group.doc: Summary quantities which are the result of some post-processing of the snapshot data (averaging, integrating, interpolating). Frequently used descriptors from continuum mechanics and thermodynamics can be used here. A few examples are given. Each descriptor is currently modelled as an instance of an NXprocess because it is relevant to understand how the descriptors are computed.

group.name: temperature
group.doc: Evolution of the simulated temperature over time.

group.name: kinetics
group.doc: Evolution of the recrystallized volume fraction over time.

field.name: time
field.doc: Measured or simulated physical time stamp for this snapshot. Not to be confused with wall-clock timing or profiling data.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Simulated temperature.

field.name: iteration
field.doc: Iteration or increment counter.

field.name: grain_identifier
field.doc: Grain identifier for each cell.

field.name: thread_identifier
field.doc: Identifier of the OpenMP thread which processed this part of the grid.

group.name: recrystallization_front
group.doc: Details about those cells which in this time step represent the discretized recrystallization front.

field.name: halo_region
field.doc: Which cells are currently in a halo region of threads.

field.name: mobility_weight
field.doc: So-called mobility weight which is a scaling factor to control the mobility of the grain boundary which is assumed to sweep currently this volume.

field.name: coordinate
field.doc: Grid coordinates of each cell in the recrystallization front.

field.name: deformed_grain_identifier
field.doc: Grain identifier assigned to each cell in the recrystallization front.

field.name: recrystallized_grain_identifier
field.doc: Grain identifier assigned to each nucleus which affected that cell in the recrystallization front.

field.name: recrystallized_volume_fraction
field.doc: Relative volume transformed as a measure of infection progress.

field.name: thread_identifier
field.doc: Identifier of the OpenMP thread processing each cell in the recrystallization front.

field.name: infection_direction
field.doc: Hint about the direction from which the cell was infected.

field.name: euler
field.doc: Bunge-Euler angle triplets for each grain.

field.name: volume
field.doc: Discrete volume of each grain accounting also for partially transformed cells.

field.name: dislocation_density
field.doc: Current value for the dislocation density as a measure of the remaining stored energy in assumed crystal defects inside each grain. The difference between these values scales the driving force of grain boundary migration.

field.name: is_deformed
field.doc: Is the grain deformed.

field.name: is_recrystallized
field.doc: Is the grain recrystallized.

field.name: value
field.doc: Currently evaluated actual recrystallized volume fraction. This takes into account partially recrystallized cells.

field.name: target
field.doc: Currently desired target recrystallized volume fraction at which the user requested to log a snapshot.

field.name: value
field.doc: Currently assumed globally applied Cauchy stress tensor on the ROI.

field.name: value
field.doc: Currently assumed globally applied Cauchy strain tensor on the ROI.

field.name: number_of_processes
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_processes in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_threads
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_gpus
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.
